data.question: What is the DOI of the article discussing new scaffolding-like materials?
Who are the authors of the article published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society in 1990?
data.answer: B. F. Hoskins and Richard Robson

data.question: In which year was the article about the design and construction of a new class of scaffolding-like materials published electronically?
Is the supplementary material for the article available without a subscription to ACS Web Editions?
Can users republish or redistribute any Supporting Information from the ACS website without permission from the American Chemical Society?
What is the main focus of the article with DOI 10.1021/ja00160a038?
data.answer: The design and construction of a new class of scaffolding-like materials comprising infinite polymeric frameworks of 3D-linked molecular rods.

data.question: What are the materials discussed in the article related to the synthesis and structure of diamond-related frameworks?
Based on the article, does the American Chemical Society hold copyright ownership of the Supporting Information?
For permission to reproduce, republish, and redistribute material from the ACS website, what system must requesters use?
What is the publication format of the ISSN mentioned in the article metadata?
Is the article titled 'Design and construction of a new class of scaffolding-like materials...' considered a review article?
What type of materials does the article focus on?
data.answer: Scaffolding-like materials comprising infinite polymeric frameworks

data.question: Are the structure factors for zinc cyanide included in the supporting information?
What is the role of [N(CH3)4][CuIZnII(CN)4] in the context of the article?
data.answer: It is one of the diamond-related frameworks discussed in the synthesis and structure analysis.

data.question: Does the article provide observed and calculated structure factors for cadmium cyanide?
What is the significance of CuI[4,4',4'',4'''-tetracyanotetraphenylmethane]BF4.xC6H5NO2 in the study?
data.answer: It represents another example of the diamond-related frameworks being studied.

data.question: According to the article, can the supporting information files be downloaded for personal use?

data.answer: To introduce a new class of materials that includes infinite polymeric frameworks of 3D-linked molecular rods.
